title: Did San Diego hire a "ring maker " to end the drought in 1916?
subtitle: Charles Hatsfield promised to fill the drained city tanks using a secret formula and 35 feet "floating towers."
author: David Emery
vclaim: In December 1915, San Diego agreed to pay $10,000 to Charles Hatfield's "Trainmaker" to put an end to the region's drought; over the next few weeks, the city was flooded with rain and suffered one of the worst floods in its history.
